docComment:
/**
 * Provides a {@link @veramo/did-manager#DIDManager | plugin} for the {@link @veramo/core#Agent} that implements {@link @veramo/core-types#IDIDManager} interface.
 *
 * @packageDocumentation
 */
name: @veramo/kv-store

members.docComment:
/**
 * A Key Value store is responsible for managing Values identified by keys.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IKeyValueStore
clear

members.docComment:
/**
 * Delete a value from the store by key
 *
 * @param key - The key to delete the value for
 */
members.name: delete

members.docComment:
/**
 * Delete multiple values by provided keys
 *
 * @param keys - The keys to delete the values for
 */
members.name: deleteMany
disconnect

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get a single value by key. Can be undefined as the underlying store typically will not throw an error for a non existing key
 *
 * @param key - Contains the key to search for
 */
members.name: get

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get a single item as Value Data from the store. Will always return a Value Data Object, but the value in it can be undefined in case the actual store does not contain the value
 *
 * @param key - Contains the key to search for
 */
members.name: getAsValueData

members.docComment:
/**
 * @remarks
 *
 * in order to consume the iterator, you need to use the for await syntax as follows:
 *
 * for await (const result of store.getIterator()) { console.log(result) }
 *
 * @returns An async iterator for all the keys in the store
 */
members.name: getIterator

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get multiple values from the store. Will always return an array with values, but the values can be undefined in case the actual store does not contain the value for the respective key
 *
 * @param keys - Contains the keys to search for
 */
members.name: getMany

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get multiple items as Value Data from the store. Will always return an array with Value Data Object, but the value in it can be undefined in case the actual store does not contain the value
 *
 * @param keys - Contains the keys to search for
 */
members.name: getManyAsValueData

members.docComment:
/**
 * Determine whether the store has the value belonging to the provided key
 *
 * @param key - The key to search for
 */
members.name: has

members.docComment:
/**
 * Store a single value
 *
 * @param key - The key
 *
 * @param value - The value
 *
 * @param ttl - An optional number how long to store the value in milliseconds. If not provided will be stored indefinitely
 */
members.name: set

members.docComment:
/**
 * A store adapter implementation needs to provide namespace support
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IKeyValueStoreAdapter

members.docComment:
/**
 * Event listener arguments
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IKeyValueStoreOnArgs

members.docComment:
/**
 * Options for the Key Value store
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IKeyValueStoreOptions
namespace
store
ttl
uri

members.docComment:
/**
 * This is how the store will actually store the value. It contains an optional `expires` property, which indicates when the value would expire
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IValueData

members.docComment:
/**
 * Class that implements the {@link @veramo/kv-store#IKeyValueStore} interface
 *
 * This class is a Key Value store that leverages a port of the keyv package internally. The store does not leak the types of the Keyv port, so it could be replaced with another implementations if we want to.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: KeyValueStore
KeyValueTypeORMOptions

members.docComment:
/**
 * TypeORM based key value store adapter
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: KeyValueTypeORMStoreAdapter

members.docComment:
/**
 * The migrations array that SHOULD be used when initializing a TypeORM database connection.
 *
 * These ensure the correct creation of tables and the proper migrations of data when tables change between versions.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: kvStoreMigrations

members.docComment:
/**
 * The types that can be stored by a store adapter
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: ValueStoreType
